issue.title: [C++] Utilize zero-copy protobuf parsing from upstream whenever it becomes available
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3201](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3201). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This has been discussed for a couple of years now; perhaps with Abseil this could happen at some point:

https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/issues/1896

Using zero-copy proto parsing (which is standard practice inside Google, but not available in open source protocol buffers) would obviate the need for the zero-copy workaround that I'm going to implement for C++ Flight RPCs

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3201?focusedCommentId=17197301) by David Li (lidavidm):*
This is still not available in Protobuf, removing from 2.0
